1.1.1.name: Non-text Content
implementation: All images have alt attributes
Decorative images use aria-hidden='true' and empty alt
SVG icons include aria-label or are marked aria-hidden

1.3.1.name: Info and Relationships
implementation: Semantic HTML5 elements (nav, main, section, article, aside, footer)
ARIA landmarks for page regions
Proper heading hierarchy (h1-h6)
Form labels associated with inputs

1.3.2.name: Meaningful Sequence
implementation: Logical reading order in DOM
Tab order follows visual flow
CSS does not disrupt content order

1.3.3.name: Sensory Characteristics
implementation: Instructions do not rely solely on shape, size, or visual location
Audio/visual content has text alternatives

1.4.1.name: Use of Color
implementation: Color not used as only visual means of conveying information
Links distinguished by underline or other non-color indicator
Error states use icons/text in addition to color

1.4.3.name: Contrast (Minimum)
implementation: Normal text: 4.5:1 contrast ratio
Large text (18pt+ or 14pt+ bold): 3:1 contrast ratio
UI components and graphical objects: 3:1 contrast ratio

1.4.4.name: Resize Text
implementation: Text can be resized up to 200% without loss of content or functionality
Relative units (rem, em) used for font sizes
Responsive design supports text scaling

1.4.5.name: Images of Text
implementation: Text used instead of images of text where possible
Logos and essential graphics excepted
SVG text preferred over raster images

1.4.10.name: Reflow
implementation: Content reflows to 320px width without horizontal scrolling
Responsive design prevents 2D scrolling
Mobile-first approach ensures reflow compliance

1.4.11.name: Non-text Contrast
implementation: UI components have 3:1 contrast ratio
Focus indicators meet contrast requirements
Interactive elements clearly distinguishable

1.4.12.name: Text Spacing
implementation: Line height at least 1.5x font size
Paragraph spacing at least 2x font size
Letter spacing at least 0.12x font size
Word spacing at least 0.16x font size

1.4.13.name: Content on Hover or Focus
implementation: Hover/focus content dismissible without moving pointer
Content remains visible while hovering
Additional content does not obscure original trigger

2.1.1.name: Keyboard
implementation: All functionality available via keyboard
No keyboard traps
Custom controls have proper keyboard handling
Tab order is logical and intuitive

2.1.2.name: No Keyboard Trap
implementation: Users can navigate away from all components using keyboard
Modals can be closed with Escape key
Focus returns to triggering element when closing dialogs

2.1.4.name: Character Key Shortcuts
implementation: Single character shortcuts can be turned off or remapped
Shortcuts only active when component has focus

2.2.1.name: Timing Adjustable
implementation: Time limits can be turned off, adjusted, or extended
Users warned before time expires

2.2.2.name: Pause, Stop, Hide
implementation: Auto-updating content can be paused, stopped, or hidden
Carousels have pause/play controls
Animations respect prefers-reduced-motion

2.4.1.name: Bypass Blocks
implementation: Skip to main content link provided
ARIA landmarks enable screen reader navigation
Heading structure supports content navigation

2.4.2.name: Page Titled
implementation: Every page has unique, descriptive title
Title describes page purpose or topic

2.4.3.name: Focus Order
implementation: Focus order preserves meaning and operability
Tab order follows visual layout
No unexpected focus changes

2.4.4.name: Link Purpose (In Context)
implementation: Link purpose clear from link text or context
Aria-label provides additional context where needed
No generic 'click here' links

2.4.5.name: Multiple Ways
implementation: Multiple navigation mechanisms (menu, search, sitemap)
Breadcrumbs for hierarchical navigation
Related links within content

2.4.6.name: Headings and Labels
implementation: Headings describe topic or purpose
Labels describe purpose of inputs
Consistent heading hierarchy throughout site

2.4.7.name: Focus Visible
implementation: Focus indicator visible with 3:1 contrast ratio
focus-visible pseudo-class used
Custom focus styles for better visibility

2.5.1.name: Pointer Gestures
implementation: All multipoint/path-based gestures have single-pointer alternative
Swipe gestures have button alternatives

2.5.2.name: Pointer Cancellation
implementation: Click events fire on up-event, not down-event
Users can abort/undo accidental activation

2.5.3.name: Label in Name
implementation: Accessible name includes visible label text
aria-label consistent with visual label

2.5.4.name: Motion Actuation
implementation: Functions triggered by device motion have alternative input
Motion can be disabled in user preferences

3.1.1.name: Language of Page
implementation: HTML lang attribute set on root element
Language changes marked with lang attribute

3.1.2.name: Language of Parts
implementation: Foreign language passages marked with lang attribute
Proper language codes used (en, es, fr, etc.)

3.2.1.name: On Focus
implementation: Receiving focus does not initiate change of context
No automatic navigation or form submission on focus

3.2.2.name: On Input
implementation: Changing settings does not automatically cause context change
Explicit submit/apply buttons for form changes

3.2.3.name: Consistent Navigation
implementation: Navigation mechanisms in same relative order across pages
Consistent header/footer across site

3.2.4.name: Consistent Identification
implementation: Icons, buttons, links with same function use consistent labels
UI patterns consistent throughout application

3.3.1.name: Error Identification
implementation: Errors identified and described in text
aria-invalid and aria-describedby used for error messaging
Error messages associated with inputs

3.3.2.name: Labels or Instructions
implementation: Labels or instructions provided for user input
Required fields clearly marked
Input format examples provided where needed

3.3.3.name: Error Suggestion
implementation: Suggestions provided for input errors when known
Helpful error messages guide user to correction

3.3.4.name: Error Prevention (Legal, Financial, Data)
implementation: Submissions are reversible, checked, or confirmed
Confirmation dialogs for critical actions

4.1.1.name: Parsing
implementation: Valid HTML5 markup
No duplicate IDs
Properly nested elements

4.1.2.name: Name, Role, Value
implementation: ARIA roles, states, and properties correctly applied
Custom controls have proper accessible names
Interactive elements programmatically determinable

4.1.3.name: Status Messages
implementation: Status messages use role='status' or role='alert'
aria-live regions for dynamic updates
Screen readers notified of important changes
